reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade.

This award strives to support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade. In addition, this award From March 12-19, 2016, the USDA Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service (APHIS), International Technical and Regulatory Capacity Building (ITRCB) Center conducted a workshop that was structured after similar US-based training with classroom and laboratory exercises which provide participants with a solid understanding of economically important diseases of animals and how to intervene in their control. The components of the TAD Workshop included: 1) introduction of participants to the major emerging and transboundary animal diseases that affect global trade in animals and animal products and thus impact food security; 2) review of international organizations and standards which regulate animal agriculture trade; and 3) practical hands-on field experience in necropsy techniques, sample collection, on-farm cleaning/disposal and general biosecurity for a variety of species..

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: The primary goal of U.S. assistance to Mongolia is to strengthen the country's institutional capacity to meet its global, regional, and domestic commitments. After several years of double-digit economic growth, Mongolia's natural resource-based economy faltered in 2014 as government missteps aggravated the effect of falling commodity prices on global markets. Foreign direct investment into Mongolia came to a virtual halt in 2015 and economic growth declined precipitously. These trends magnify the importance of U.S. assistance, now limited to Mongolia's defense, law enforcement, and border forces. U.S. training and equipment will help continue the professionalization of Mongolia's defense forces, bolster Mongolia's participation in United Nations Peacekeeping Operations (UNPKO), and promote continued participation in missions in Afghanistan. U.S. assistance will also continue to support priority nonproliferation activities due to Mongolia's highly porous borders and geographic proximity to regional proliferators.

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: Salaries and Expenses, Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Agriculture
